awd_titl_txt: Improving the Instructional Laboratory for Digital Hardware Design
awd_abstract_narration: This project modernizes the current digital hardware                       laboratory in terms of both equipment and pedagogy.  It                         supports a redesigned hardware development system and                           redesigned laboratory projects.  The concept of a large                         student project that extends over a six month period is                         retained and the construction of a fully functional                             minicomputer from basic integrated circuit components is                        still required.  New student projects will  emphasize                           programmable logic devices in addition to hardwired circuits,                   and will incorporate modern simulation and logic minimization                   tools.  In the microprogrammed-control phase of the project,                    the new equipment will offer greatly enhanced interactive                       design and debugging capabilities.                                                   This project is significant because it provides a                          laboratory in which  undergraduate students can build designs                   using programmable logic devices as well as modern simulation                   and logic minimization tools.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
